radiographic_examinations.findings: Uptake in a rib posteriorly on the right side, in the left side of the skull, and in the maxilla on the left side, questionable lesions in the lumbar spine, all indeterminate for cancer.
Hyperdense lesions in the left acetabulum, sacrum, third lumbar vertebral body on the left, and the 9th and 10th ribs on the right posteriorly.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Radiographs of the ribs and lumbosacral spine

radiographic_examinations.findings: No enhancement of the lesion in the L3 vertebral body, a probable bone island at the pedicle of the third lumbar vertebra, and a hemangioma at the second lumbar vertebra.
Focus of intense uptake in the left lateral frontoparietal region of the skull, with multiple foci of additional uptake unchanged from the previous study.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: No change and no new uptake since the previous study.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Adenocarcinoma with a Gleason score of 7 found in 3 cores taken from the anterior prostate and a focus of adenocarcinoma in one core taken from the left lateral prostate.
